intro: Cyrtandra × fusata, commonly known as the hybrid Hawaiian blue ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet floral bracts. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by native bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
